info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 31 at 6:12PM CDT until August 31 at 9:15PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following county, Hunt.
* WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are forecast. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Farmersville, Wolfe City, Caddo Mills, Celeste, Campbell, Greenville City Lakes, Merit, Greenville Club Lake, Josephine, Neylandville, Kellogg, Kingston, Center Point, Floyd, Clinton, South Sulphur and Dixon.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING
